oai_dc:dc.dc:title: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopic studies of the valence state of tl in single-tl-o-layered tlba1-xsrxlacuo5 (0-less-than-or-equal-to-x-less-than-or-equal-to-1)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUNDARESAN, A
GOPINATH, CS
TAMHANE, AS
RAJARAJAN, AK
SHARON, M
SUBRAMANIAN, S
PINTO, R
GUPTA, LC
VIJAYARAGHAVAN, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: copper-oxide superconductors
nonstoichiometry
temperature
system
holes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The valence state of thallium in TlBa1-xSrxLaCuO5 (x = 0.0, 0.4, 0.7, and 1.0) has been investigated by measuring Tl 4f core levels by x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. It is shown that the valence state of Tl in TlBaLaCuO5 (nonsuperconducting) is 3+, whereas that in TlSrLaCuO5 (superconducting, T(c) = 32 K) is between 3+ and 1+. The origin of holes in the latter compound is discussed in terms of charge transfer between Tl ions and Cu-O layers as has been found in double-Tl-O-layered compounds.
